result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain a valid drivers license. Pay ZCI fees. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Obtain a valid drivers license. Pay ZCI fees. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Garcia-Cihler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $394.00.  Defendant due to discharge 05-13-2017.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Def is undecided about seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 as amended to Possession of THC & count 2.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 as amended & count 2.

Count 1- Withheld sentence, 1 Year Probation

Count 2- Withheld sentence, 1 Year Probation

Conditions:
Maintain employment
Obtain a valid drivers license 
$200 fine + cc on count 1
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 1 only
Waive CC on count 2
Pay outstanding ZCI fees with bond money
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request a Plea / Sentencing date.
BTC: VACATE Warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Not sure why the defendant is not present today. Request if the court issues a warrant, it be stayed for 48 hours.
BTC: Bench warrant issued, stay for 48 hours.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond modification. 
State does not object. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $500.00 cash bond. Same conditions apply.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Anthony Garcia-Cihler in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
